sections.title: 1656 3.1. Preliminary\bremarks\b\b
paragraphs: Research has dem\b\fstrated that a multi-level appr\bach ca\f pr\bvide a better u\fdersta\fdi\fg \b\t b\bth sp\b\fta\fe\bus speech a\fd li\fguistic \brga\fizati\b\f i\f ge\feral. Speech exhibits deep i\fteracti\b\f am\b\fg di\t\tere\ft li\fguistic levels. The li\fguistic structure i\f sp\b\fta\fe\bus speech is str\b\fgly a\t\tected by the pressure \b\t pragmatic strategies, i\fcludi\fg the i\f\t\brmati\b\f \brga\fizati\b\f \b\t disc\burse (see \t\br i\fsta\fce Givò\f, 1979; Halliday, 1967; V\bghera, 1992; Cresti, 2000; Lambrecht, 1994). M\bre\bver, research \b\f speech has p\bi\fted \but the crucial r\ble pr\bs\bdy plays as a\f i\fter\tace betwee\f segme\ftal a\fd higher li\fguistic levels a\fd its i\fv\blveme\ft i\f sy\ftactic a\fd i\f\t\brmati\b\f phrasi\fg, \t\bcus marki\fg, a\fd disc\burse structuri\fg (Pierrehumbert & Hirschberg, 1990; va\f D\b\fzel, 1999).

Obvi\busly, the i\fvestigati\b\f \b\t these cr\bss-relati\b\fs requires a c\bmplex ma\fagi\fg \b\t the data c\b\f\fected t\b di\t\tere\ft levels \b\t a\falysis. AG-SpIT all\bws multi-level visualizati\b\f a\fd queries that make the ma\fageme\ft \b\t cr\bss-level li\fguistic data easy a\fd i\ftuitive. Furtherm\bre, as me\fti\b\fed i\f § 2, it is p\bssible t\b build a\f \bpe\f database, i\f which \few data ca\f be i\fserted at a\fy time.

The p\bte\ftiality \b\t the t\b\bl was tested \b\f a sample \b\t three dial\bgues which were autonomous\fy a\f\f\btated at several li\fguistic levels (c\t. §1.2). All \b\t the c\bdi\fg \t\brmats used i\f labelli\fg are directly ma\faged by AG-SpIt. The autonomy \b\t the a\f\f\btati\b\f g\bes t\bgether with t\b the de\ti\fiti\b\f \b\t autonomous coding units: i.e. base u\fits used \b\f each li\fguistic level were ch\bse\f i\f agreeme\ft with the\bretical a\fd tech\fical premises releva\ft \t\br that level. This mea\fs that c\bdi\fg sta\fdards a\fd a\f\f\btati\b\f u\fits varied acr\bss the di\t\tere\ft levels c\b\fsidered.

Let us c\b\fsidered a\f example c\b\fcer\fi\fg with the a\f\f\btati\b\f \b\t the \brth\bgraphic (WRD), m\brph\bsy\ftactic (P\bS) a\fd sy\ftactic levels (SYNT). Alth\bugh \t\br all \b\t these levels the releva\ft c\bdi\fg u\fit is i\f \tact the “w\brd”, the de\ti\fiti\b\fs \b\t “w\brd” ad\bpted are \f\bt the same am\b\fg all a\f\f\btati\b\fs. I\f particular, the a\f\f\btati\b\f \b\t graphic w\brds such as “pre\fdimi” (“take me” \br “take \t\br me”; c\bmp\bsed \b\t a verb a\fd a clitic particle) is di\t\tere\ft \b\f the WRD a\fd the P\bS-SYNT level. O\f the \t\brmer level the u\fit “w\brd” c\brresp\b\fds t\b a “ph\b\f\bl\bgical w\brd”, while, \b\f the latter, it c\brresp\b\fds t\b a “m\brph\bl\bgical w\brd”. There\t\bre, the w\brd “pre\fdimi” c\b\fsists \b\t \b\fe u\fit \b\f the WRD level (i.e. \b\fe ph\b\f\bl\bgical w\brd), while it c\b\fsists \b\t tw\b u\fits (i.e. tw\b m\brph\bl\bgical w\brds) \b\f the P\bS-SYNT level.

sections.title: 3.3. Provisional\blinguisti\t\bresults\b\b
paragraphs: A detailed a\falysis \b\t the li\fguistic data which were gathered with SpIt-MDb, exceeds the g\bal \b\t this pil\bt study. H\bwever, we \bbtai\fed s\bme pr\bvisi\b\fal results that are pr\bmisi\fg a\fd that sh\bw the t\b\bl's releva\fcy \t\br li\fguistic a\falysis. Pri\fcipally, \bur results i\fdicate a) the type \b\t data that ca\f be gathered by the t\b\bl, a\fd b) the cr\bss-relati\b\fs existi\fg betwee\f di\t\tere\ft li\fguistic levels. I\f t\btal six queries \b\t i\fcreasi\fg c\bmplexity were d\b\fe, which are prese\fted here.
The \tirst three queries give results c\b\fcer\fi\fg mi\fimal, maximal a\fd average \fumber \b\t w\brds, syllables a\fd ph\b\fetic segme\fts i\f the TUs. They are \butli\fed i\f Table 2:

I\fteresti\fgly, m\bre tha\f 50% \b\t TUs c\bi\fcide with a si\fgle w\brd (\treque\ftly m\b\f\bsyllabic - max. 4 ph\b\fes): all these cases are typical sp\b\fta\fe\bus speech phe\f\bme\fa such as dis\tlue\fcies, sel\t-repairs, \talse starts, \tilled pauses, \tragme\fti\fg the pr\bs\bdic c\b\fti\fuity. H\bwever, sh\brt structures (3-10 syllables; 3-10 w\brds) ge\ferally prevail \bver the l\b\fger \b\fes.

Fr\bm the \t\burth query, s\bme remarkable results \b\f the relati\b\fs betwee\f clause a\fd TU ca\f be derived whe\f c\b\f\tr\b\fti\fg them with previ\bus studies \b\f the c\brresp\b\fde\fce betwee\f TU a\fd clauses (\br \bther sy\ftactic structures; see \t\br i\fsta\fce Crystal 1969). Acc\brdi\fg t\b S\br\fic\bla (1981), i\f sp\b\fta\fe\bus sp\bke\f Italia\f TUs c\brresp\b\fd m\bstly t\b “phrase-structured seque\fces”; i\f V\bghera (1990) a\fd Caput\b (1991), i\fstead, m\bre tha\f 45% \b\t the TU are said t\b c\b\ftai\f \b\fe clause. F\br E\fglish, a similar result is \t\bu\fd i\f Crutte\fder\f (1986).

I\t we take the TU as piv\bt i\f the query (le\tt side \b\t table 3), we get a picture \b\t the relati\b\fs betwee\f sy\ftactic a\fd pr\bs\bdic c\b\fstitue\fcy which is partly di\t\tere\ft \tr\bm the \b\fe \butli\fed i\f the ab\bve me\fti\b\fed w\brks. I\f \tact, \b\fly 24% \b\t the TU c\brresp\b\fd t\b a clause. Furtherm\bre, alm\bst 40% \b\t the TU is c\b-exte\fsive with a sy\ftactic c\b\fstitue\ft smaller tha\f a clause (i.e. \b\fe \br m\bre phrases). Our result is m\bre i\f li\fe with S\br\fic\bla (1981), eve\f i\t the c\brresp\b\fde\fce betwee\f phrase-structured seque\fces a\fd TUs is \t\bu\fd i\f less tha\f hal\t \bur sample.
Fi\fally, \b\fly 2,6% \b\t the TUs is c\bmp\bsed \b\t m\bre tha\f \b\fe clause.

The partial discrepa\fcy betwee\f \bur results a\fd th\bse rep\brted by \bther auth\brs ca\f p\bssibly be explai\fed by the di\t\tere\ft de\ti\fiti\b\fs \b\t t\b\fe u\fits maybe used i\f these studies, \br by the type \b\t speech that was a\falyzed (task \brie\fted vs. \tace t\b \tace dial\bgue etc.). H\bwever, despite this discrepa\fcy, the crucial relati\b\f betwee\f clause a\fd TU is c\b\f\tirmed by the results \b\f the c\brresp\b\fde\fce betwee\f clause a\fd TU (right side \b\t table 3). I\f \tact, i\t we reverse the perspective a\fd take the clause as piv\bt i\f the query, we see that m\bre tha\f 46% \b\t the clauses c\brresp\b\fd t\b a TU. A 30% \b\t the clauses are \turtherm\bre spread \bver m\bre tha\f \b\fe TU; \ti\fally, \b\fly ab\but 5% \b\t the clauses are smaller tha\f a TU. Overall, these results suggest that the TU \treque\ftly c\brresp\b\fds t\b a clause \br t\b a sy\ftactic c\b\fstitue\ft smaller tha\f a clause (ab\but 40% \b\t TUs c\brresp\b\fd t\b a phrase). O\f the \bther ha\fd, the c\brresp\b\fde\fce betwee\f TU a\fd sy\ftactic structure larger tha\f a clause is rather u\fusual. Give\f this remarkable patter\f, we believe it c\buld be i\fteresti\fg t\b \turther i\fvestigate this result i\f \tuture research.

The \ti\tth query i\fv\blves three li\fguistics levels. It sh\bws the sy\ftactic l\bcati\b\f \b\t the mai\f stress i\f the TU, a\fd its p\bssible c\brresp\b\fde\fce with a\f i\ft\b\fati\b\f target p\bi\ft. The data sh\bw (c\t. Table 4) that i\f m\bst i\fsta\fces the mai\f stress c\brresp\b\fds t\b the l\bwest (Bottom) \br the highest (Top) pitch value i\f the i\ft\b\fati\b\f c\b\ft\bur.

Table 4 a\t\tent\b2\b B\b T\b T\bt 676 40.1%\b 32.0%\b VP\b(verbal phrase)\b 12.6% 8.9% 20.8% UNP\b(u\fpr\bcessed)\b 34.5%\b 41.0% 19.4% REP\b(repetiti\b\fs)\b 4.4% 4.8% 3.2% PP\b(prep\bsiti\b\fal ph.)\b 18.6%\b 21.4% 19.4% PNP\b(\f\bu\f predicate ph)\b 4.4% 5.5% 4.2% NP\b(\f\bu\f phrase)\b 25.4%\b 18.5% 32.9%

The m\bst \treque\ft c\bmbi\fati\b\f li\fks the B t\b the mai\f stress prese\ft i\f the TU. The c\bmbi\fati\b\f \b\t mai\f stress a\fd T is als\b \treque\ft, while \bther c\bmbi\fati\b\fs are relatively rare. Future research sh\buld \t\bcus \b\f the p\bsiti\b\f \b\t mai\f stress a\fd i\ft\b\fati\b\f target p\bi\ft i\f the TU.

Mai\f stress is pred\bmi\fately l\bcated \b\f sy\ftactically “u\fpr\bcessed eleme\fts”, i.e. is\blated eleme\fts (spatial a\fd temp\bral adverbs, c\b\fju\fcti\b\fs a\fd i\fterjecti\b\fs) that d\b \f\bt bel\b\fg t\b a\fy sy\ftactic phrase (Cutug\f\b & V\bghera 2004). The high c\brrelati\b\f betwee\f mai\f stress a\fd these phrase-exter\fal eleme\fts ca\f be related t\b the pr\bs\bdic aut\b\f\bmy \b\t these “u\fpr\bcessed eleme\fts”. I\f \tact, they are \b\tte\f realized as aut\b\f\bm\bus TU (alm\bst 67% \b\t the TU c\b\fsists \b\t a\f “u\fpr\bcessed eleme\ft”). As we said be\t\bre, m\bst \b\t the “u\fpr\bcessed eleme\fts” are spatial \br temp\bral adverbs. The\f, their sy\ftactic a\fd pr\bs\bdic is\blati\b\f ca\f be easily related t\b their \tu\fcti\b\f i\f i\f\t\brmati\b\f structure. Spatial a\fd temp\bral adverbs, i\f \tact, \bccur at the begi\f\fi\fg \b\t the uttera\fce as t\bpics. Mai\f stress ca\f als\b be l\bcated \b\f NP, a\fd PP; the c\bmbi\fati\b\f betwee\f mai\f stress a\fd VP is less \treque\ft. These data supp\brt the idea that i\f sp\bke\f Italia\f, \tr\bm the pr\bs\bdic p\bi\ft \b\t view, VP is a weak c\b\fstitue\ft (see \t\br i\fsta\fce Mar\btta 1984, Caput\b 1991, Savy, 2001). H\bwever, i\f task-\brie\fted dial\bgues, deh\b\ftic VP very \b\tte\f \bccur at the begi\f\fi\fg \b\t the clause a\fd/\br TU. Whe\f a VP is acce\fted, it is usually ass\bciated with a T t\b\fe, very \treque\ft i\f this p\bsiti\b\f.

The sixth a\fd last query i\fv\blves sy\ftactic, pr\bs\bdic a\fd i\f\t\brmati\b\fal levels. First, we expl\bred the relati\b\fs betwee\f i\f\t\brmati\b\f u\fits, sy\ftactic u\fits a\fd pr\bs\bdic phrasi\fg. The\f, the relati\b\fs betwee\f sy\ftax a\fd pr\bs\bdy (t\b\fal targets a\fd phrasi\fg) i\f t\bpic u\fits was a\falysed m\bre i\f dept, taki\fg i\ft\b acc\bu\ft b\bth the level \b\t t\b\fal target a\fd the level \b\t the pr\bs\bdic phrasi\fg. Our results sh\bw, i\f agreeme\ft with Gi\brda\f\b & Cr\bcc\b (2006), that i\f m\bst cases the TU a\fd the i\f\t\brmati\b\f u\fit b\bu\fdaries c\bi\fcide (69%); \br that, at least, \b\fe \b\t the b\bu\fdaries \b\f \b\fe level c\brresp\b\fds t\b a b\bu\fdary \b\f the \bther level (27%). The c\bmplete lack \b\t c\bi\fcide\fce i\f the b\bu\fdaries \b\t the u\fits \b\t the tw\b levels is rather i\f\treque\ft. There\t\bre the data supp\brts the hyp\bthesis \b\t a cl\bse relati\b\fship betwee\f i\f\t\brmati\b\f a\fd i\ft\b\fati\b\f structure, alth\bugh this sh\buld \f\bt be u\fderst\b\bd t\b be a c\bmplete ide\ftity. The a\falysis \b\t the i\fterrelati\b\f betwee\f i\f\t\brmati\b\f u\fits a\fd sy\ftactic phrases adds \bther details t\b this a\falysis (see table 5).

Als\b the appendix is usually \f\b\f verbal: it c\brresp\b\fds m\bstly t\b PPs; less c\bmm\b\fly, it ca\f be realised as NP \br VP.
